name: Cerberus Canyon (North Fork)
description:
Introduction

Canyon with lots of rappels (including two around 270').

Approach

Park at Dantes View vault toilet. Walk to nearby tan saddle, and down the other side. Gentle slopes on approach, no ball-bearings on rock (unlike the approach to Cerberus's South Fork).

Descent

Waypoints in the KML map contain detailed descriptions of all the rappels (courtesy of Bluugnome.com).

Exit

Red tape

Bolting is not permitted.

Beta sites

  • BluuGnome.com : Cerberus Canyon - North Fork
  • Super Amazing Map : Cerberus Canyon - North Fork

Trip reports and media

EVEN FURTHER CEREBRUS CANYON NORTH FORK

Background

First descent (of north fork), 18 February 2012: Kirk Belles, Mike Cressman, Mark Duttweiler, Luke Galyan, Chris Hood, Steve Kazakos, Rick Kent, Joan Pan, Steve (Ram) Ramras, Tina Tretina, Jenny West. (Alphabetical order.)

properties.name: RP-01
properties.description: Down climb of about 15 feet.

properties.name: R1
properties.description: Rap 1 - North Fork Cerberus Canyon. Anchored from a large rock horn RDC and drops about 30 feet on a mostly vertical wall. Can be down climbed RDC but sketchy.

properties.name: RP-02
properties.description: Down climb of about 8 feet that can be awkward for shorter people since it drops over an overhaning boulder.

properties.name: RP-03
properties.description: Down climb of about 8 feet shortly after getting good views out toward the salt flats in the distance.

properties.name: RP-04
properties.description: Slightly sloped down climb of about 15 feet in a slot.

properties.name: R2
properties.description: Rap 2 - North Fork of Cerberus Canyon. Anchored from a rock horn about 35 feet back from the drop and a total of about 130 feet of rope travel is needed from anchor to bottom of rap.

properties.name: RP-05
properties.description: Down climb of about 15 feet. Looks difficult but is easier than it looks. All but the last person can rappel on a meat anchor then the last person can down climb with a spot from below.

properties.name: RP-06
properties.description: Down climb of about 15 feet with a ledge about 10 feet down.

properties.name: R3
properties.description: Rap 3 - North Frok of Cerberus Canyon. Anchored from a large rock about 20 feet back. Rap 3 drops about 60 feet but about 80 feet of rope travel is needed from anchor to bottom of rap.

properties.name: R4
properties.description: Rap 4 - North Fork Cerberus Canyon. Anchored from a rock horn near the top of the drop and drops about 60 feet down a mostly vertical wall.

properties.name: R5
properties.description: Rap 5 - North Fork of Cerberus Canyon. Anchored from a carin anchor RDC and travels about 160 feet over 3 stages.

properties.name: R6
properties.description: Rap 6 - North Fork of Cerberus Canyon. Anchored from a large rock about 15 feet back and drops about 12 feet.

properties.name: RP-07
properties.description: Top of a large wide shelf like area over looking the confluence of the North and South Forks below.

properties.name: NF-SF join
properties.description: Confluence of North and South Forks of Cerberus Canyon.

properties.name: R9
properties.description: Rap 9 in Cerberus. Anchored from a small boulder LDC and drops about 35 feet down a water carved slot

properties.name: R10-11
properties.description: Raps 10 and 11 in Cerberus. Rap 10 anchored from small boulder and drops 25 feet. Rap 11 anchored from small boulder and drops 50 feet with overhanging ledge.

properties.name: R12
properties.description: Rap 12 in Cerberus. Anchored LDC from lodged boulder and drops about 15 feet along a couple boulders.

properties.name: R13-14
properties.description: Raps 13 and 14 in Cerberus. Rap 13 anchored from small cairn and drops 140 feet down series of ledges getting steeper as it drops. Rap 14 at the bottom of rap 13 and anchored from rock horn at top of rap and drops a bit over 50 feet down a large crack. Rap 14 can be down climbed, see route description.

properties.name: R15
properties.description: Rap 15 in Cerberus. Anchored from choke stone wedged under boulder and drops 25 feet. Could be a down climb for some.

properties.name: R16
properties.description: Rap 16 in Cerberus. Anchored from a rock protruding from the ground and drops over 40 feet over 2 stages. 15 feet and 25 feet.

properties.name: RP-01
properties.description: Climb up and around LDC to bypass drop.

properties.name: R17-18
properties.description: Raps 17 and 18 in Cerberus. Rap 17 anchored from i pinch point about 20 feet back and drops 50 feet needing about 70 feet of rope travel. Rap 18 anchored from double cairn and drops 115 feet down a fluted wall worth taking time to enjoy the look of it.

properties.name: R19-20
properties.description: Raps 19 and 20 in Cerberus. Rap 19 cairn style anchor and drops 160 feet with 40 foot overhang. Rap 20 anchored from rock protruding from ground and drops 35 feet down sloped wall. Anchor about 40 feet upcanyon of drop.

properties.name: R21
properties.description: Rap 21 in Cerberus. Anchored from pile of rocks behind protruding rock. Drops 270 feet over 3 stages. 30 feet, 30 feet and 210 feet.

properties.name: R22
properties.description: Rap 22 in Cerberus. Anchored from small boulder at top of rap. Drops 35 feet between large boulder and canyon wall RDC. Awkward over hang.

properties.name: R23-24
properties.description: Raps 23 and 24 in Cerberus. Rap 23 anchored from large rock laying in wash and drops 45 feet down nice water carved flute. Rap 24 anchored from choke stone under boulder and drops 20 feet down a vertical wall. Rap 24 is down climbable.

properties.name: R25
properties.description: Rap 25 in Cerberus. Anchored from large rock protruding from ground and drops 90 feet over 2 stages.

properties.name: RP-02
properties.description: By pass a couple drops by going up an over the ledges LDC.

properties.name: R26
properties.description: Rap 26 in Cerberus. Anchored from rock at top of rap and drops about 270 feet. Starts with 50 foot chute to ledge then down a vertical wall with about 50 foot overhang near bottom.

properties.name: RP-03
properties.description: 15 foot down climb in a water chute. Can be rappelled if desired by wrapping rope around rock at top of DC.

properties.name: R27-28
properties.description: Raps 27 and 28 in Cerberus. Rap 27 anchored from protruding rock and drops 40 feet down water carved chute. Rap 28 anchored from cairn and drops 90 feet down fairly smooth vertical wall.

properties.name: R29
properties.description: Rap 29 in Cerberus. Anchored from large rock in wash and drops 70 feet over 2 stages.

properties.name: Parking Exit
properties.description: Park a vehicle here along the highway for transportation after exiting the bottom of Cerberus Canyon.
